feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 3 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 2 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: The system struggles with precise leap year day calculations in service duration and gratuity computations.
findings.issue_explanation: Multiple tickets revealed inconsistent handling of February 29th and total service days in leap years, causing minor calculation discrepancies.
findings.limitation_statement: Platform lacks robust leap year day handling in service duration and gratuity calculations.
findings.gap_statement: Need enhanced calendar logic to automatically and accurately account for 366-day years.

findings.group_description: Inconsistent and complex daily wage calculation methods across different payroll scenarios.
findings.issue_explanation: Multiple configuration paths exist for daily wage calculations, causing user confusion about divisors, salary components, and calculation methods.
findings.limitation_statement: No unified, transparent mechanism for configuring daily wage calculations across leave, proration, and gratuity scenarios.
findings.gap_statement: Need a standardized, configurable daily wage calculation framework with clear user guidance.

findings.group_description: Lack of real-time synchronization between Time Off, Leave, and Payroll modules causes calculation inconsistencies.
findings.issue_explanation: Public holiday additions, leave requests, and payroll processing are not dynamically synchronized, leading to retroactive calculation challenges.
findings.limitation_statement: Current system cannot automatically recalculate deductions when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.
findings.gap_statement: Require enhanced inter-module communication and dynamic recalculation capabilities.

troubleshooting.group_description: Workaround for handling incorrect unpaid leave deductions when configurations change.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: 1. Delete and recreate leave request before payroll processing. 2. Use manual deduction adjustments. 3. Verify global vs policy-level daily rate configurations.

troubleshooting.group_description: Steps to manually verify gratuity calculations across different service periods.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: 1. Manually break down service duration by years. 2. Apply correct tier-based calculation (21 days for first 5 years, 30 days after). 3. Use 366 days for leap years. 4. Prorate partial years by actual days worked.

glossary.definition: The number of days used to calculate an employee's daily rate, which can vary between 30, 30.42, or 365/366 depending on system configuration.
Days counted for salary calculations, which may exclude weekends and public holidays based on employee work week configuration.
